text: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) is an Indian government agency attached to the Ministry of Culture that is responsible for archaeological research and the conservation and preservation of cultural monuments in the country. It was founded in 1861 by Alexander Cunningham who also became its first Director-General. Its headquarter is in New Delhi. Category:Government agencies of India Category:1861 establishments in Asia Category:1860s establishments in Asia Category:19th-century establishments in India Category:Archaeological sites in India
title: Archaeological Survey of India
